clinical_study.brief_title: Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Personalized Prophylaxis Human-cl rhFVIII in Patients With Severe Haemophilia A
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Open-label, Multi-centre Phase 3b Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Personalized Prophylaxis With Human-cl rhFVIII in Previously Treated Adult Patients With Severe Haemophilia A

brief_summary.textblock: The rationale of this study is to further fine-tune and individualize prophylactic treatment of patients with severe Haemophilia A with the goal of keeping the trough FVIII level above 1% between doses. Because trough FVIII levels are likely to be important predictors of the efficacy of prophylaxis, the focus of this study is on pharmacokinetic (PK) data.

primary_outcome.measure: Annualized Total Bleeding Rate of Individually Tailored Prophylaxis
primary_outcome.description: Total annualized bleeding rate (ABR) of individually tailored prophylaxis (GENA-21b) compared to historical bleeding rate in patients having received on-demand treatment (GENA-01) with Human-cl rhFVIII

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized Spontaneous Bleeding Rate of Individually Tailored Prophylaxis
secondary_outcome.description: Spontaneous annualized bleeding rate (ABR) of individually tailored prophylaxis (GENA-21b) compared to historical bleeding rate in patients having received on-demand treatment (GENA-01) with Human-cl rhFVIII

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized Total Bleeding Rate in Patients With 2x/Week (or Less) Prophylaxis
secondary_outcome.description: Total annualized bleeding rate (ABR) in patients with 2x/week (or less) prophylaxis (GENA-21b) compared to historical bleeding rate in patients having received on-demand treatment (GENA-01) with Human-cl rhFVIII

Median over median actual dosing intervals between two prophylactic treatments per patient. The median time (hours) between two prophylactic doses of Human-cl rhFVIII in the prophylactic treatment Phase II per patient

Mean over mean actual dosing intervals between two prophylactic treatments per patient. The mean time (hours) between two prophylactic doses of Human-cl rhFVIII in the prophylactic treatment Phase II per patient

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At each study visit over the study duration (7-9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: AEs were documented at each (scheduled or unscheduled) study visit. Severity and seriousness of all AEs were documented by the investigator according to pre-defined criteria

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Severe Haemophilia A (FVIII:C < 1%)
- Male patients >= 18 years of age
- Previous treatment with a FVIII concentrate for at least 150 EDs
- Good documentation regarding dosing and bleeding frequency in the 6 months preceding study start
- Immunocompetence (CD4+ count > 200/uL)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any coagulation disorder other than Haemophilia A
- Present of past FVIII inhibitor activity
- Severe liver or kidney disease

facility.name: Centre Régional de Traitement de l'Hémophilie
Centre Régional de Traitement de l'hémophilie
Hôpital Purpan - Centre de Traitment Regional de l'Hemophilie Pole
Hospital of the Univ of Occupational and Environmental Health
St. Marianna Univ School of Medicine Hospital
PHI Institute of Transfusion Medicine of Republic of Macedonia

removed_countries.country: Macedonia, The Former Yugoslav Republic of

group.title: Human-cl rhFVIII
group.description: The study consisted of 3 phases: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Phase: 58 previously treated (≥150 exposure days) immunocompetent adults with severe hemophilia A without inhibitors patients started and completed the PK phase (PK population). Patients were treated with single dose of FVIII (60±5 IU/kg). One patient discontinued after single PK administration. Prophylactic Treatment Phase I: 57 patients started and 56 completed Phase I; Patients were treated prophylactically every other day or 3x/week with a dose of 30–40 IU/kg BW for 1–3 months until PK data had been analysed. Prophylactic Treatment Phase II: 56 patients started and 52 completed Phase II. Patients were treated prophylactically for 6 months using the dose and dosing interval based on individual PK data. All 58 patients were included in the safety (SAF) and the intention-to-treat (ITT) populations.

group.title: SAF/ITT Population
group.description: All patients who received at least one infusion of Human-cI rhFVIII

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Hemophilia Joint Health Score
measure.description: Joint health status will be assessed using the Hemophilia Joint Health Score (HJHS), which evaluates six index joints to produce a score between 0-124. Higher scores indicate worse joint health.

outcome.title: Annualized Total Bleeding Rate of Individually Tailored Prophylaxis
outcome.description: Total annualized bleeding rate (ABR) of individually tailored prophylaxis (GENA-21b) compared to historical bleeding rate in patients having received on-demand treatment (GENA-01) with Human-cl rhFVIII
outcome.population: The analysis population comprised 56 patients who received at least one infusion of Human-cI rhFVIII for individualized prophylaxis in the GENA-21b trial. Their annualized bleeding rate was compared with those in patients from the completed GENA-01 trial who received only on-demand treatment.

group.title: Individualized Prophylaxis in GENA-21b
group.description: Patients who received at least one infusion of Human-cI rhFVIII for individualized prophylaxis

group.title: GENA-01
group.description: All patients receiving on-demand treatment with Human-cl rhFVIII in GENA-01

measure.title: Annualized Total Bleeding Rate of Individually Tailored Prophylaxis
measure.description: Total annualized bleeding rate (ABR) of individually tailored prophylaxis (GENA-21b) compared to historical bleeding rate in patients having received on-demand treatment (GENA-01) with Human-cl rhFVIII
measure.population: The analysis population comprised 56 patients who received at least one infusion of Human-cI rhFVIII for individualized prophylaxis in the GENA-21b trial. Their annualized bleeding rate was compared with those in patients from the completed GENA-01 trial who received only on-demand treatment.

analysis.estimate_desc: A confidence interval of 97.5% for confirmative analysis was also used - the respective upper and lower limit CIs were 3.96-5.93

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Reduction of the annualized total bleeding rate (ABR) observed in the GENA-01 study vs. GENA-21B analyzed with a Negative Binomial regression model including a correction for overdispersion.
Reduction of the annualized total bleeding rate (ABR) observed in the GENA-01 study vs. GENA-21B analyzed with a Poisson regression model including a correction for overdispersion.

outcome.title: Annualized Spontaneous Bleeding Rate of Individually Tailored Prophylaxis
outcome.description: Spontaneous annualized bleeding rate (ABR) of individually tailored prophylaxis (GENA-21b) compared to historical bleeding rate in patients having received on-demand treatment (GENA-01) with Human-cl rhFVIII
outcome.population: The analysis population comprised 56 patients who received at least one infusion of Human-cI rhFVIII for individualized prophylaxis in the GENA-21b trial. Their annualized spontaneous bleeding rate was compared with those in patients from the completed GENA-01 trial who received only on-demand treatment.

group.title: Individualised Prophylaxis in GENA-21b
group.description: Patients who received at least one infusion of Human-cI rhFVIII for prophylaxis

group.title: GENA-01
group.description: All patients receiving on-demand treatment with Human-cl rhFVIII in GENA-01

measure.title: Annualized Spontaneous Bleeding Rate of Individually Tailored Prophylaxis
measure.description: Spontaneous annualized bleeding rate (ABR) of individually tailored prophylaxis (GENA-21b) compared to historical bleeding rate in patients having received on-demand treatment (GENA-01) with Human-cl rhFVIII
measure.population: The analysis population comprised 56 patients who received at least one infusion of Human-cI rhFVIII for individualized prophylaxis in the GENA-21b trial. Their annualized spontaneous bleeding rate was compared with those in patients from the completed GENA-01 trial who received only on-demand treatment.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: A respective confirmative one-sided one-sample Poisson-test was used to demonstrate if the mean spontaneous ABR in patients with individually tailored prophylaxis is at least 50% below the mean ABR rate in the GENA-01 trial.

outcome.title: Annualized Total Bleeding Rate in Patients With 2x/Week (or Less) Prophylaxis
outcome.description: Total annualized bleeding rate (ABR) in patients with 2x/week (or less) prophylaxis (GENA-21b) compared to historical bleeding rate in patients having received on-demand treatment (GENA-01) with Human-cl rhFVIII
outcome.population: The analysis population comprised 29 patients who received at least one infusion of Human-cI rhFVIII for individualized prophylaxis in the GENA-21b trial at intervals of 2x/week or less. Their annualized spontaneous bleeding rate was compared with those in patients from the completed GENA-01 trial who received only on-demand treatment.

group.title: Prophylaxis 2x/Week or Less
group.description: Patients who received at least one infusion of Human-cI rhFVIII for prophylaxis and were treated with a prophylaxis infusion frequency of 2x/week or less

group.title: GENA-01
group.description: All patients receiving on-demand treatment with Human-cl rhFVIII in GENA-01

measure.title: Annualized Total Bleeding Rate in Patients With 2x/Week (or Less) Prophylaxis
measure.description: Total annualized bleeding rate (ABR) in patients with 2x/week (or less) prophylaxis (GENA-21b) compared to historical bleeding rate in patients having received on-demand treatment (GENA-01) with Human-cl rhFVIII
measure.population: The analysis population comprised 29 patients who received at least one infusion of Human-cI rhFVIII for individualized prophylaxis in the GENA-21b trial at intervals of 2x/week or less. Their annualized spontaneous bleeding rate was compared with those in patients from the completed GENA-01 trial who received only on-demand treatment.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: A respective confirmative one-sided one-sample Poisson-test was used to demonstrate if the mean ABR in patients with 2x/week prophylaxis or less with individually tailored prophylaxis is at least 50% below the mean ABR rate in the GENA-01 trial.
analysis.estimate_desc: A confidence interval of 97.5% for confirmative analysis was also used - the respective upper and lower limit CIs were 3.76–6.60

outcome.population: The analysis population comprised 56 patients who received at least one infusion of Human-cI rhFVIII for individualized prophylaxis in the GENA-21b trial.

outcome.population: The PK-PP population contained all patients in the PK analysis population who completed the initial PK sampling phase of the trial without significantly violating the inclusion/exclusion criteria or other aspects of the protocol considered to potentially affect the PK results.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Octapharma agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Octapharma supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial. Octapharma also reserves the right to review data prior to publishing and provide comments/changes within a certain time period.
